info.name: Property Poobah
info.description: Bid for the right to invest in the city's 13 districts. Smart investors will get a lot of value for little investment. Money is tight, so you'll have to take loans — but the more loans you take, the less money you get, and the more you'll have to pay them back at the end of the game.
info.ruleText:
The goal of the game is to have the most money at the end. Win auctions to acquire player tokens and place them on the board. For each district, the player with the most tokens will earn money at the end of the game — but ties cancel out! Players may also take loans during the game, but there are diminishing returns, and each one is worth negative points/money at the end.

After setup, there are 18 groups of 4 tokens each, and a black token that moves around a track near the groups. Each space on the track corresponds to one of the 18 groups of tokens. On a player's turn, they roll the die, and move the black token that many spaces clockwise around the track, skipping any spaces that are empty of tokens. Where the black token lands, the corresponding group of four tokens is auctioned off to the highest bidder.

Starting with the current player, players in turn make a bid on how much they are willing to pay to acquire the group of tokens. On their turn to bid, a player may either increase the current highest bid by at least 1, or pass. Once they pass, they are out of the auction and cannot re-enter. After all players pass but one, the remaining player pays their bid to the bank and acquires the four tokens.

Players may not bid more than the amount of money they possess. However, once per auction, a player may take a loan. The first loan taken grants 9 money, the second loan grans 8 money, and so on. Loans cannot be paid back. At the end of the game, subtract 10 from your score for every loan you've taken.

The winning bidder acquires the four tokens and places them on any empty spaces on the board. They can be in the same district or spread out among multiple districts. Once placed, tokens are never moved or removed and remain there until the end of the game.

There are seven spaces in each of 13 districts. No district can have more than seven tokens. 

After the auction winner places all four tokens in any districts they wish, it is the next player's turn, who rolls the die and advances the black token around the track as described previously (skipping any spaces that no longer have any tokens). Gameplay continues until all tokens have been placed in the districts.

At the end of the game, the player with the most tokens of their colour in a district gains money/VP as outlined below. However, if two or three players tie for the most, their tokens are ignored. The winner of the district is the player who has the most tokens that isn't involved in a tie.
  • Downtown districts are worth the value printed in their upper-right corner (16-21).
  • Suburban districts are worth the value printed in their upper-right corner (9-11). However, if the winner of the district also owns the neighbouring park, the suburb's value is doubled.
  • Park districts (showing 2x) are worth nothing themselves. However, a player who wins a park district doubles the value of any neighbouring suburban districts they have also won. The suburban districts won by other players are not affected.
Players add the value of the districts they own to any remaining money they possess. From this, they subtract 10 money/VPs for every loan they had taken over the course of the game. The player with the most money wins.

In the original, there was also a rule that a player cannot win the game unless they win at least two districts. This is optional; the game works fine without this rule. Players should agree beforehand whether to apply this rule.

This implementation is for three or four players. A three-player game works identically to a four-player game. The colour corresponding to the seat not taken is a "dummy" colour. Players still place tokens of this colour, and these tokens still count toward determining ties in a district.
info.helpText:
After everyone has been seated, click Setup to initialize the game.
Note: If any group of four tokens are all the same colour, click Setup again. Repeat as necessary until all groups are composed of at least two different colour tokens.

Setting up the game will determine a random start player and roll the die for that player. When the turn ends, click the die to advance the turn to the next player.

When a player drops out of an auction, they should click their "IN AUCTION" card to flip it to the "OUT OF AUCTION" side, so all players can see who is still in and who has passed.
info.attribution:
Coding and layout by Darryl Boone, released to the public domain under CC0.
